'''Abdul Hafiz''' or '''Abdul Hafeez''' ({{lang-ar| عبد الحفيظ }}) is a Muslim male given name, and in modern usage, surname. It is built from the Arabic words ''[[Abd (Arabic)|Abd]]'', ''[[al-]]'' and ''Hafiz''. The name means "servant of the Guardian", ''Al-Hafīz'' being one of the [[names of God in the Qur'an]], which give rise to the [[List of Arabic theophoric names|Muslim theophoric names]].<ref name=ahmed>{{cite book| title=A Dictionary of Muslim Names| author=Salahuddin Ahmed| publisher = Hurst & Company| location=London| year=1999}}</ref><ref name=rahman> {{cite book| title=A Dictionary of Muslim Names| author= S. A. Rahman| publisher=Goodword Books| location=New Delhi| year=2001}}</ref>
The letter ''a'' of the ''al-'' is unstressed, and can be transliterated by almost any vowel, often by ''e''. So the first part can appear as Abdel, Abdul or Abd-al. The second part may appear as Hafiz, Hafeez, Hafid, Hafeedh or in other ways. The whole name is subject to variable spacing and hyphenation.
It may refer to: *[[Abdul Hafeez]], known as Senior Brigadier General of Pakistan ( 1954 ) Pakistani Social Activist *[[Abdul Hafiz Mohamed Barakatullah]], known as Maulavi Barkatullah (1854–1927), Indian independence activist *[[Abdelhafid of Morocco]] (1873–1937), Sultan of Morocco *[[Abdul Hafeez (chemist)]] (1882-1964), Pakistani scientist *[[Abdul Hafiz (VC)]] (1915-1944), Indian army soldier *[[Osman Abdel Hafeez]] (1917–1958), Egyptian fencer *[[Abdul Hafeez Kardar]], or just Abdul Kardar (1925-1996), Pakistani cricketer *[[Abdelhafid Boussouf]] (1926-1980), Algerian politician *[[Abdul Hafiz (Lieutenant General)]] (born 1957), Lieutenant General of Bangladesh Army *[[Abdul Hafiz Mansoor]] (born 1963), Afghan politician *[[Abdelhafid Tasfaout]] (born 1969), Algerian footballer *[[Yasser Abdel Hafez]] (born 1969), Egyptian novelist and journalist *[[Sayed Abdel Hafeez]] (born 1977), Egyptian footballer *[[Abdul Hafeez (English cricketer)]] (born 1977) *[[Abdelhafid Benchabla]] (born 1986), Algerian boxer *[[Abd-al-Hafid Mahmud al-Zulaytini]], Libyan politician *[[Abdul Hafeez Shaikh]], Pakistani politician *[[Abdul Hafiz Pirzada]], Pakistani lawyer and politician

= | occupation = {{hlist|[[Economist]]|[[Diplomat]]}} | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Amon Nikoi''', born '''Seth Amon Nikoi''' (19 January 1930 – 5 September 2002) was a [[Ghanaian people|Ghanaian]] [[economist]] and [[diplomat]].<ref name="BOG">{{cite web|url=http://www.bog.gov.gh/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=129%3Agovernors-and-deputy-governors-of-the-bank-since-its-inception&catid=64&Itemid=137 |title=Governors and Deputy Governors of the Bank Since its Inception |publisher=www.bog.gov.gh |accessdate=2 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114182125/http://bog.gov.gh/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=129%3Agovernors-and-deputy-governors-of-the-bank-since-its-inception&catid=64&Itemid=137 |archivedate=14 November 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Gov-t-informed-about-the-death-of-Dr-Amon-Nikoi-27747 |title=Gov't informed about the death of Dr Amon Nikoi |website=www.ghanaweb.com |language=en |access-date=2017-04-28 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=Kandymotownie |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He was the [[Permanent representative|Permanent Representative]] of [[Ghana]] to the [[United Nations]] between 1957 and 1960 as well as the [[Governor]] of the [[Bank of Ghana]] from 16 March 1973 to June 1977.<ref name="BOG"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ghanaweb.com/mobile/wap.small/news.article.php?ID%3D27747 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-11-11 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131111190528/http://ghanaweb.com/mobile/wap.small/news.article.php?ID=27747 |archivedate=2013-11-11 |df= }}</ref><ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/people/person.php?ID=171 |title=Dr Amon Nikoi, Former Governor of the Bank of Ghana |publisher=Ghanaweb.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-22 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161027192942/http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/people/person.php?ID=171 |archivedate=2016-10-27 |df= }}</ref> He also served as the [[Finance minister]] from September 1979 to May 1981 under [[Hilla Limann]] during the [[Limann government|Third Republic]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
== Early life and education == Nikoi was born in the [[Accra]] suburb of [[Labadi Beach|La]] on 19 January 1930 to [[Ga-Adangbe people|Ga-Adangbe]] parents.<ref name=":1">{{cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Former-Bank-of-Ghana-Governor-buried-at-La-28089 |title=Former Bank of Ghana Governor buried at La |website=www.ghanaweb.com |language=en |access-date=2017-04-22 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170421092109/http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Former-Bank-of-Ghana-Governor-buried-at-La-28089 |archivedate=2017-04-21 |df= }}</ref> His father, Gottfried Ashaley Nikoi was a civil servant while his mother, Agnes Betty Oboshie Quao was a teacher and a textiles trader. Amon Nikoi's maternal great-grandfather, Nii Ngleshie Addy I was the oldest son of Nii Tetteh Tsuru I, the founder and ruler of the Otuopai Clan, a royal house in [[Ga-Mashie|Ga Mashie]].
Amon Nikoi had his [[primary education]] at the Roman Catholic Jubilee Primary School in [[Cape Coast]] followed by his [[secondary school]] at [[Achimota School]] between 1945 and 1948.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> He graduated from [[Amherst College]] in 1953 with a [[Bachelor's degree|bachelor’s degree]] in [[Economics]].<ref name=":1" /> He proceeded to [[Harvard University]] as a [[Fellow]] from 1953 to 1955 for his [[Master's degree|master’s degree]] in [[Public administration|Public Administration]] and a [[doctorate]] in [[Political economy|Political Economy and Government]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> Both degrees were conferred upon Nikoi in 1956.<ref name=":1" />
== Career == From 1957 to 1960, he worked with the Commonwealth and Foreign Service as an economic and political affairs secretary-[[attaché]]<ref name="BOG" /> at the [[Embassy of Ghana in Washington, D.C.|Embassy of Ghana in Washington, DC]] and the [[Permanent representative|Permanent Representative]] of [[Ghana]] to the [[United Nations]] ([[United Nations|UN]]).<ref name=":0" /> In 1960, he was appointed the Alternate Executive Director of the [[International Monetary Fund]] ([[International Monetary Fund|IMF]]) until 1966 when he was promoted to the level of Executive Director of the [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]]. He left the [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]] to return to his homeland at the end of 1968. In January 1969, he became the first Director of Budget at the [[Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (Ghana)|Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> He was quickly given the portfolio of Senior Principal Secretary of the [[Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (Ghana)|Ministry of Finance]], a position he remained in until February 1973.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
The [[Government of Ghana|Ghanaian government]] selected and confirmed him as the new [[Governor]] and [[Chairman]] of the [[Board of directors|Board of Directors]] of the [[Bank of Ghana]] in March 1973 until his forced retirement in June 1977 by the military government, [[National Redemption Council]] (NRC) led by army general [[Ignatius Kutu Acheampong]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
When constitutional rule returned in 1979, the [[Limann government|Third Republic government]] , [[People's National Party (Ghana)|People's]] [[People's National Party (Ghana)|National Party]] ([[People's National Party (Ghana)|PNP]]) and [[Hilla Limann]] made him [[Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (Ghana)|Minister of Finance and Economic Planning]].<ref name=":1" /> He entered private practice as an Economic and Financial Consultant to various private sector firms and public institutions both home and abroad.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> He was also the Chairman of [[Ashanti Goldfields Corporation|Ashanti Goldfields Company]] ([[Ashanti Goldfields Corporation|AGC]]) and Grains Warehousing Company.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
In recognition of his services to [[Ghana]] in [[Public administration|Public Administration]] and [[Banking]], the government at the time, [[Supreme Military Council (Ghana)|Supreme Military Council II]] led by military general, [[Fred Akuffo]] awarded him the State Honour of the [[Order of the Volta]] (Civil Division).<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
== Personal life and family ==
He was married to [[Gloria Amon Nikoi]] (née Addae),<ref name="company1959"/> Ghana’s first female [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs|foreign minister]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> They had three children.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> His younger brother, Gottfried Dzane Nikoi worked in the Attorney–General's Department as a state attorney. His maternal uncle was the Ghanaian [[barrister]] and [[judge]], [[Nii Amaa Ollennu]] who was elected the [[Speaker (politics)|Speaker]] of the [[Parliament of Ghana]] during the [[Busia government|Second Republic]] as well as serving as the Chairman of the Presidential Commission and acting [[President of Ghana]] from 7 August 1970 to 31 August 1970.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.judicial.gov.gh/history/list_lawyers/home.htm|title=Official Web Site for the Judicial Service of the Republic of Ghana|date=2005-04-14|access-date=2017-06-06|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050414064831/http://www.judicial.gov.gh/history/list_lawyers/home.htm|archivedate=14 April 2005|df=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://rulers.org/rulg1.html#ghana|title=Countries Ga-Gi|website=rulers.org|access-date=2017-06-06|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070403074857/http://www.rulers.org/rulg1.html|archivedate=3 April 2007|df=}}</ref> The diplomat and public servant, [[Nathan Quao]] was also his uncle.<ref name=":02">{{Cite news|url=https://www.modernghana.com/news/74014/nathan-quao-to-be-given-state-burial-on-april-8.html|title=Nathan Quao to be given state burial on April 8|work=ModernGhana.com|access-date=2017-06-11|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref name=":14">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Nathan-Quao-to-be-given-state-burial-on-April-8-77485|title=Nathan Quao to be given state burial on April 8|website=www.ghanaweb.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-11}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Nathan-Quao-s-life-epitomises-the-Civil-Service-78893|title=Nathan Quao's life epitomises the Civil Service|website=www.ghanaweb.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-11}}</ref> His first cousins were the brothers, [[Nicholas T. Clerk|Nicholas]] and [[George C. Clerk|George Clerk.]]<ref name=":022">{{Cite web|url=http://www.odadee.net/school|title=PRESEC {{!}} ALUMINI PORTAL|date=2016-11-11|access-date=2017-06-11|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161111065106/http://www.odadee.net/school|archivedate=11 November 2016|df=}}</ref><ref name=":122">{{Cite web|url=http://www.odadee75.org/downloads/70years.pdf|title=70 years of excellent secondary education|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722010817/http://www.odadee75.org/downloads/70years.pdf|archive-date=22 July 2011|dead-url=no|access-date=|df=}}</ref>
== Death == Nikoi died of [[natural causes]] on 5 September 2002.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> His [[Funeral|funeral service]] was held at the [[Accra Ridge Church]] where he was a congregant and his remains were buried at the [[List of cemeteries in Accra|La Public Cemetery]].<ref name=":1" />

{{nq|عزیز رویش}} | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = Azizullah Royesh | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1970}} | birth_place = [[Fazel Baig]], [[Kabul, Afghanistan]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = [[Afghanistan]] | other_names = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | occupation = Teacher, social activist, writer | years_active = | employer = | known_for = | home_town = | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | opponents = | boards = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relations = | callsign = | awards = | website = | signature = | footnotes = | ethnicity = | religion = | box_width = }} '''Azizullah Royesh''' (commonly known as '''Aziz Royesh''', {{lang-fa|عزیز رویش}}) is a [[Hazara people|Hazara]], social activist, teacher and writer from [[Afghanistan]]. == Biography == Aziz Royesh was born on 1970 in [[Fazel Baig]], [[Kabul, Afghanistan]]. At age 10, He attended school until the age of 10 then he went to [[Ghazni Province]], then he moved to [[Quetta]], [[Pakistan]] alone at the age of 11, he had no family in Quetta so he worked in tailor shops, bakeries, small factories just to nourish himself but he wasn't able to continue his formal education, he used his spare time after work for self-study. Aziz Royesh in 1986 at the age of 16 returned to Afghanistan and established five schools in Ghazni province. With the [[Taliban]] coming back in 1994, he returned to Pakistan and established the [http://marefat.edu.af/en/ Marefat High School] for [[Afghanistani]] Refugees in Pakistan, After the fall of the Taliban in 2001, the high school was transferred to Kabul [[Dashte Barchi]] by maintaining a branch in Pakistan.{{Cite news|url=http://www.globalteacherprize.org/top-10-finalist/azizullah-royesh/|title=Azizullah Royesh – The Global Teacher Prize|work=The Global Teacher Prize|access-date=2017-10-29|language=en-US}} == Best Teacher of the World == In 2015 he nominated the Best Teacher of the Year in the world.{{Cite news|url=http://www.afghanzariza.com/2015/03/14/afghan-teacher-azizullah-royesh-a-top-contender-to-win-2015-global-teacher-prize|title=Afghan teacher Azizullah Royesh a top contender to win 2015 Global Teacher Prize|work=Afghan Zariza|access-date=2017-10-29|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/education-31386576|title=Dancing scientist in teacher prize|last=Coughlan|first=Sean|date=13 February 2015|work=BBC News|access-date=2017-10-29|language=en-GB}} == Publications == * The book in [[Dari language]], ''{{lang-prs|"بگذار نفس بکشم"}}{{Cite web|url=http://8am.af/1391/12/05/book-unveal-kabul-royesh/|title=کتاب "بگذار نفس بکشم" رونمایی شد {{!}}|website=8am.af|access-date=2017-10-29}}'' == See also == * [[List of Hazara people]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.facebook.com/azizulah.royesh Aziz Royesh official Facebook]. * [http://www.afghan-bios.info/index.php?option=com_afghanbios&id=3257&task=view&total=3351&start=2574&Itemid=2 www.afghan-bios.info] * [http://worldfellows.yale.edu worldfellows.yale.edu/Azizullah Royesh] {{Hazara nationalism}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Royesh, Aziz}} [[Category:Hazara people]] [[Category:Hazara writers]] [[Category:Hazara politicians]] [[Category:People from Kabul]] [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=February 2014}} {{BLP primary sources|date=March 2014}} }} {{Infobox person |name = Basir Ahang
{{small|{{lang|prs|بصیر آهنگ}}}} |image = BasirAhang.JPG |alt = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1984}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |body_discovered = |death_cause = |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = |residence = |nationality = |ethnicity = |citizenship = |other_names = |known_for = [[Poet]], [[journalist]] and [[human rights activist]] |education = |employer = |occupation = |years_active = |home_town = |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |title = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |opponents = |boards = |religion = |spouse = |partner = |children = |parents = |relations = |callsign = |awards = |signature = |website = [http://www.basirahang.com/ www.basirahang.com] |footnotes = |box_width = }} {{Hazara people}} '''Basir Ahang''' ({{lang-prs|بصیر آهنگ}}) is a [[Hazara people|Hazara]] [[poet]], [[journalist]] and [[human rights activist]] from [[Afghanistan]]. He lives in [[Italy]] and works for [[UNHCR]].{{cite web|url=http://frontierenews.it/2013/06/il-canto-del-rifugiato-questo-momento-mi-appartiene/|title=Il canto del rifugiato: “Questo momento mi appartiene” | Frontiere|publisher=frontierenews.it|accessdate=2014-02-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2011/12/20111211135052458863.html|title=Europe no sanctuary for Afghan asylum seekers - Features - Al Jazeera English|publisher=aljazeera.com|accessdate=2014-02-26}} == Biography == Basir Ahang has received his diploma from Mir Adina High School in Malistan-Ghazni, and has received his [[bachelor]] degree in [[Persian language|Persian]] [[Literature]] from [[Kabul University]] in 2007. While studying at Kabul University, he has been collaborating with different national and international media. He is one of [[Radio]] Malistan founders. Basir Ahang is best known for his social and cultural as well as human rights activities both in Afghanistan and in Europe that makes him an effective and influential figure among the youth. == Moving to Italy == After receiving security alerts for his activities in Afghanistan, Basir Ahang moved to Italy In 2008 where he continued his studies in [[International Relations]] in [[Padua University]]. In 2009, after being informed about the condition of the Afghanistan [[asylum seekers]] in [[Greece]], he went to [[Patras]] city with a team of MSF (doctors without borders) and Italian [[advocates]] and journalists. His first reports in Persian that were published on Kabul Press,{{cite web|url=http://www.kabulpress.org/my/spip.php?auteur957|title=بصیر آهنگ - Kabul Press | Afghanistan Press | کابل پرس | افغانستان پرس|publisher=kabulpress.org|accessdate=2014-02-26}} and in Italian on Italian news websites,{{cite web|url=http://www.ilprimoamore.com/blogNEW/blogDATA/spip.php?article6|title=il primo amore|publisher=ilprimoamore.com|accessdate=2014-02-26}} shocked everyone, as no one had such first-person detailed reports from refugees and asylum seekers in Greece that far. Basir Ahang is a member of [[International Federation of Journalists]] since January 2009. On March 31, 2009, the [[Italian parliament]] showed a reaction to one of his reports on misbehavior of Italian police with a minor named Ali Dad who was thirteen. The parliament asked the authorities to pursue the case. Basir Ahang made a documentary about the [[refugees]] and asylum seekers in Greece and after a part of this documentary was broadcast on Rai,”1” Italy’s public television, it caught the attention of journalists and human rights organizations and they were pushed to go to Greece to be able to see the condition of refugees and the violation of their rights and report on it. After these events in May 2009, some lawyers and human rights activists filed a complaint in the [[European Human Rights Court]] in [[Strasbourg]] [[France]],{{cite web|url=http://www.meltingpot.org/Una-speranza-per-i-profughi-di-Patrasso.html#.Uw415_ldWSq|title=Una speranza per i profughi di Patrasso - Progetto Melting Pot Europa|publisher=meltingpot.org|accessdate=2014-02-26}} against the Italian and the Greek governments for their misbehavior and violation of refugees’ rights in these two countries. In this complaint, they asked the EHRC to prevent the systematic refugee’s rights violation, by putting pressure on the Italian and Greek governments. The complaint is still in process after the EHRC has accepted the claim. The complaint includes files of 54 asylum seekers from Afghanistan and [[Somalia]] who were tortured by the Italian and Greek police. == Writing and journalistic activities == Out of many articles in Italian about human rights and [[socio-political crisis]] in Afghanistan, three of Ahang’s articles are published in the books below; 1- Geopolitics of Peace 2009 Venice-Italy 2- Afghanistan; Cuore, Fede e Ragione 2012 Milan-Italy 3- Ripartire 2013 Rome- Italy Ahang has so far, written hundreds of reports on refugees and their legal rights, [[women rights]], [[freedom of speech]] and human rights violation]] in Afghanistan. His articles are written in Persian, Italian and English which are published in different online and printing media such as; [[Kabul Press]], [[BBC Persian]]{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/persian/world/2010/12/101209_hn_afghan_refugees_greece_081210.shtml|title=BBC فارسی - جهان - آلبوم عکس: پناهجویان افغانی در یونان|publisher=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2014-02-26}} {{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/persian/afghanistan/2011/09/110910_k02-afghan-refugees-greece.shtml|title=BBC فارسی - افغانستان - پناهجویان افغان در یونان، بی سرپناه و نگران|publisher=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2014-02-26}} {{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/persian/afghanistan/2010/12/101209_hn_afghan_refugees_greece_story.shtml|title=BBC فارسی - افغانستان - سرنوشت نا معلوم پناهجویان افغان در یونان|publisher=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2014-02-26}} {{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/persian/afghanistan/2011/09/110908_l13_pics_afghan_refugee_greece.shtml|title=BBC فارسی - افغانستان - پناهجویان افغان در یونان|publisher=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2014-02-26}} , [[Radio Zamaneh]]{{cite web|url=http://archive.radiozamaneh.com/society/women/2012/08/01/17787|title=کابوس ترسناک زنان افغانستان | رادیو زمانه |Radiozamaneh|publisher=archive.radiozamaneh.com|accessdate=2014-02-26}} ,{{cite web|url=http://zamanehdev.redbee.nl/38985#.Uw43evldWSp|title=داستان سحر گل، تصویری از زندگی زنان افغانستان|publisher=zamanehdev.redbee.nl|accessdate=2014-02-26}} [[Deutsche Welle]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.de/%D9%88%D8%B6%D8%B9-%D9%85%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AC%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%81%D8%BA%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%AF%D8%B1%DB%8C%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%AF%D8%B1%DA%AF%D9%81%D8%AA%DA%AF%D9%88%D8%A8%D8%A7-%D8%A8%D8%B5%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%A2%D9%87%D9%86%DA%AF/a-4048878-1|title=وضع مهاجران افغانستان دریونان درگفتگوبا بصیرآهنگ | مصاحبه ها | DW.DE | 22.02.2009|publisher=dw.de|accessdate=2014-02-26}} [[Hazara People International Network]], [[Refugee Face]], [[Republic of Silence]], [[Gharjistan]], [[Outlook Afghanistan]] and the [[8 a.m Daily]]. Some of his articles are translated in French, [[German language|German]] and [[Arabic]] as well. In 2013 the [[Aljazeera]] website has named him the Expert on refugees’ issues. Basir Ahang has participated in several conferences on refugees, women’s rights, and Afghanistan crisis. He has also been appreciated by some human rights organizations for his activities. == See also == *[[List of Hazara people]] == References == == External links == *[http://www.basirahang.com Basir Ahang's personal website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ahang, Basir}} [[Category:Hazara people]] [[Category:Hazara writers]] [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Afghan journalists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hazara poets]] [[Category:Hazara journalists]] [[Category:Experts on refugees]]

| occupation = [[Educator]], [[politician]] | years_active = 1992 – present | nationality = Ugandan | citizenship = [[Uganda]] | residence = [[Kampala]], [[Uganda]] | known_for = [[Politics]] | networth = | home_town = [[Mubende]] | title = State Minister for Kampala Capital City Authority in the [[Cabinet of Uganda]] | spouse = '''{{small|Mr. Bugembe}}''' }} '''Benna Namugwanya Bugembe''' (née Benna Namugwanya) is a [[Uganda]]n politician. She is the [[Kampala Capital City Authority|State Minister for Kampala Capital City Authority]] in the [[Cabinet of Uganda|Ugandan Cabinet]]. She was appointed to that position on 6 June 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.monitor.co.ug/blob/view/-/3235304/data/1345443/-/3o16hn/-/Museveni%2527s+cabinet.pdf|title=Museveni’s new cabinet list At 6 June 2016| accessdate=11 June 2016|date=6 June 2016 | location=Kampala | author=Uganda State House| newspaper=[[Daily Monitor]]| format=PDF}} She concurrently serves as the [[Mubende District|Mubende District Woman Representative]] in the 10th [[Parliament of Uganda|Parliament]] (2016–2021).{{cite web|accessdate=8 October 2017 | url=http://www.parliament.go.ug/mp_database/profile.php?mid=297 | date=8 October 2017 |publisher=[[Parliament of Uganda]] (POUG) | location=Kampala |title=Parliament of Uganda: Members Of The 10th Parliament: Namugwanya Bugembe Benny| author=POUG}} ==Background and education== She was born on 21 September 1967, in modern-day [[Mubende District]]. She attended [http://www.stedwardsbukuumi.sc.ug/ Saint Edwards College], in Bukuumi, in modern-day [[Kakumiro District]], for her O-Level studies. She transferred to [https://ihmrsistersggogonya.org/education/st-kizito-high-school-bethany/ Saint Kizito High School Bethany], in Ngugulo, in modern-day [[Mityana District]], for her A-Level education. In 1989, she was admitted to [[Makerere University]], in [[Kampala]], the largest city and capital of Uganda. She graduated in 1992 with a [[Bachelor of Education]]. Later in 2006, the same University awarded her a [[Master of Education]]. Benna Namugwaya also holds a [[Human resource management|Diploma in Human Resource Management]], obtained from the [[Uganda Management Institute]] in 2007 and a [[Administrative law|Certificate in Administrative Law]], awarded by the [[Law Development Centre]] in 2009. ==Career== Her first job was as a teacher at Alliance High School, serving in that capacity until 1995. Shen transferred to Saint Augustine College, in [[Wakiso]], teaching there from 1996 until 1998. In 1998, Benna Namugwanya was hired by [[Mubende District|Mubende District Local Government]], as an Inspector of Schools, serving in that capacity for six years. In 2004, she was promoted to the position of Assistant District Education Officer, in Mubende District, serving in that capacity for one year. In 2005, she was again promoted to Acting District Education Officer, serving for two years in that position. She became the District Education Officer in 2007, serving in that capacity until 2010. In 2011 she entered Ugandan elective politics, by contesting the Mubende District Women's Constituency, under the ruling [[National Resistance Movement]] political party ticket. She won and was re-elected in 2016. In the cabinet list, released on 6 June 2016, Namugwanya was named the Minister of State for Kampala Capital City authority Affairs, deputizing [[Beti Kamya-Turwomwe|Beti Olive Namisango Kamya-Turomwe]], the full cabinet minister.{{cite web| accessdate=8 October 2017 | url=http://www.statehouse.go.ug/media/news/2016/06/06/president-announces-new-cabinet | title=President announces new Cabinet |date=6 June 2016 | publisher=State House Uganda |author=Presidential Press Unit | location=Entebbe}} ==See also== * [[Cabinet of Uganda]] * [[Parliament of Uganda]] * [[Kampala Capital City Authority]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.parliament.go.ug/ Website of Parliament of Uganda] {{DEFAULTSORT:Namugwanya, Benna}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ganda people]] [[Category:Mubende District]] [[Category:Ugandan educators]] [[Category:People from Mubende District]] [[Category:Members of the Parliament of Uganda]] [[Category:Government ministers of Uganda]] [[Category:People from Central Region, Uganda]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:21st-century women politicians]] [[Category:Women government ministers of Uganda]] [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Women members of the Parliament of Uganda]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Brandon & Leah | image = | image_size = | landscape = <!-- yes, if wide image, otherwise leave blank --> | alt = | caption = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Malibu, California]] | genre = [[Indie pop]] | years_active = | label = {{flatlist| * [[Independent record label|Independent]] * [[Warner Bros. Records]] {{small|(former)}}}} | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = {{Unbulleted list|Brandon Jenner|Leah Jenner}} }}
'''Brandon & Leah''' is an American-based [[indie pop]] group made up of ex husband and wife team Brandon and Leah Jenner.
Brandon and Leah have known each other since they were in middle school and began playing music together in high school. They were married on May 31, 2012 in [[Hawaii]] outside the St. Regis Princeville Resort.<ref>{{cite news|last=Menza|first=Kaitlin|title=OK! Next Big Deal: Brandon & Leah Jenner Talk Music and Keeping Up with the Kardashians|url=http://okmagazine.com/meet-the-stars/ok-next-big-deal-brandon-leah-jenner-talk-music-and-keeping-up-with-the-kardashians/|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[OK!]]|date=August 8, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Stueven|first=Michele|last2=Silverman|first2=Stephen M.|title=Brandon Jenner Marries Leah Felder in Hawaii|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20600347,00.html|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=June 1, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Specktor|first=Brandon|title=Adorable Duo Brandon and Leah Met in Middle School|url=http://community.sparknotes.com/2012/03/22/adorable-duo-brandon-and-leah-met-in-middle-school|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[SparkNotes]]|date=March 22, 2012}}</ref>
Their sound has been described as indie pop, hip-hop based reggae, and electro-pop-soul. They are influenced by soul, reggae, pop, and hip-hop.<ref name="PR166250">{{cite news|last=Sundell|first=Karen|title=Brandon & Leah Shoot Up to #82 on the Billboard 200 With "Cronies," Graduating from #24 Billboard "Hotseekers" Re-entry Position|url=http://www.mi2n.com/press.php3?press_nb=166250|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=Music Industry News Network|date=July 23, 2013|agency=[[Rogers & Cowan]]}}</ref><ref name="self bio">{{cite web|title=Our Story|url=http://brandonandleah.com/bio/|work=Brandon & Leah (Official website)|accessdate=February 15, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019173222/http://brandonandleah.com/bio/|archivedate=October 19, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Perricone|first=Kathleen|title=Brandon Jenner and Leah Felder Perform Songs From Debut EP|url=http://www.ryanseacrest.com/2013/07/07/brandon-jenner-and-leah-felder-perform-songs-from-debut-ep/|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[On Air with Ryan Seacrest]]|date=July 7, 2013}}</ref>
The group met popularity when their single, "Showstopper" was used as the theme song for ''[[Kourtney and Kim Take Miami]]'' on [[E! Entertainment]].<ref name = "THR">{{cite news|last=Herndon|first=Jessica|title=Brandon & Leah: Keeping Up With the Kardashians, Yes, But Nepotism Is a No-No|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/earshot/brandon-leah-keeping-up-kardashians-599673|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 5, 2013}}</ref><ref name="MusicalHalf">{{cite news|last=Lazar|first=Shira|title=The Musical Half of the Kardashian Family Release Debut Album (WATCH)|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/shira-lazar/the-musical-half-of-the-k_b_3001234.html|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=April 2, 2013}}</ref> Initially Brandon and Leah were signed to [[Warner Bros. Records]], but they soon opted to release their music on their own.<ref>{{cite news|title=10 Questions with ... Brandon & Leah|url=http://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/10-questions/archive/16214/10-questions-with-brandon-leah|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=All Access Music Group|date=April 30, 2013}}</ref>
Along with Tony Berg, they produced their debut EP, ''Cronies'', which was released on April 9, 2013.<ref name="MusicalHalf"/> It has reached #82 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], #16 on the ''Billboard'' Independent Albums Chart, and #24 on the ''Billboard'' Digital Albums chart.<ref name="PR166250"/><ref name="self bio"/><ref>{{cite news|title=Brandon & Leah Enter Billboard's "Top New Artist Albums" Charts At No 31 With "Cronies"|url=http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=89340|accessdate=February 15, 2014|newspaper=Top40-Charts.com|date=April 26, 2013}}</ref> They released their second EP, ''Together'', on October 14, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Together – EP by Brandon & Leah|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/together-ep/id929480651|website=[[iTunes]]|publisher=[[Apple Inc.]]|accessdate=March 16, 2015}}</ref>
They previously performed together in a band called Big Dume.
==Members ==
===Brandon Jenner=== Brandon Jenner was born in [[Los Angeles County|Los Angeles]] on June 4, 1981 to retired U.S. track and field Olympian [[Caitlyn Jenner]] and actress [[Linda Thompson (actress)|Linda Thompson]]. His ex-stepmother was [[Kris Jenner]] from 1991 to 2015. He is the brother of [[Brody Jenner]], now ex-stepbrother of [[Kourtney Kardashian|Kourtney]], [[Kim Kardashian|Kim]], [[Khloé Kardashian|Khloé]], and [[Rob Kardashian]], and half-brother of [[Kendall Jenner|Kendall]], [[Kylie Jenner|Kylie]], and Burton Jenner, and Cassandra Marino.<ref name = "THR"/><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.californiabirthindex.org/birth/brandon_thompson_jenner_born_1981_14938031 |title = Brandon Thompson Jenner, Born 6/4/1981 in California |publisher = [[California Birth Index]] |accessdate = March 21, 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/bruce-jenners-children-discuss-pain-fathers-absence-forgiveness/story?id=30606905|title=Bruce Jenner's Children Discuss Pain of Father's Absence, Forgiveness|publisher=ABC News|date=April 27, 2015|accessdate=June 3, 2015}}</ref>
With his younger brother, Brody, he was on the TV reality show ''[[The Princes of Malibu]]''. He appears on the reality shows ''[[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]]'' and ''Kourtney and Kim Take Miami''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1085553,00.html|title=Divorce for Mom on Princes of Malibu|last=Silverman|first=Stephen M.|publisher=''[[People (magazine)|People]]''|date=July 22, 2005|accessdate=April 30, 2015}}</ref>
===Leah Jenner=== Leah Elizabeth Jenner ([[Name at birth|née]] Felder, born November 24, 1982) is the daughter of former [[Eagles (band)|Eagles]] guitarist [[Don Felder]]. Along with husband Brandon, she appeared on the reality TV shows ''Keeping Up with the Kardashians'' and ''Kourtney and Kim Take Miami''.<ref name = "THR"/><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.californiabirthindex.org/birth/leah_elizabeth_felder_born_1982_15325467 |title = Leah Elizabeth Felder, Born 11/24/1982 in California |publisher = [[California Birth Index]] |accessdate = March 21, 2015 }}</ref>
Brandon and Leah were married in Hawaii on May 31, 2012. On March 15, 2015, she announced that she and husband Brandon were expecting their first child together.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://celebritybabies.people.com/2015/03/15/brandon-jenner-leah-felder-jenner-pregnant-expecting-first-child/ | title = Brandon and Leah Jenner Expecting First Child | publisher = ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' | first = Lanford | last = Beard | date = March 15, 2015 | accessdate= March 21, 2015 }}</ref> She gave birth to a baby girl named Eva James Jenner on July 22, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2015/07/26/brandon-and-leah-jenner-welcome-daughter/|title=Brandon and Leah Jenner Welcome Daughter|publisher=''People''|first=Anya|last=Leon|date=July 26, 2015|accessdate=July 26, 2015}}</ref> On September 10, 2018, Brandon and Leah announced that they were amicably separating.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/966936/brandon-jenner-and-leah-jenner-break-up-after-6-years-of-marriage|title=Brandon Jenner and Leah Jenner Break Up After 6 Years of Marriage|date=September 10, 2018|work=E! Online|accessdate=2018-09-10}}</ref>

{{Refimprove|date=November 2008}} {{Infobox person | birth_name = Brooks John Joseph Mileson | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1947|11|13}} | birth_place = [[Pennywell]], [[Sunderland, Tyne and Wear|Sunderland]], England | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2008|11|3|1947|11|13}} | death_place = [[Carlisle, Cumbria]], England | occupation = {{hlist|Businessman|philanthropist}}<!--Please do not add to this list without first discussing your proposal on the talk page. --> }} '''Brooks John Joseph Mileson''' (13 November 1947 – 3 November 2008) was an English businessman and the owner of now dissolved professional [[Association football|football]] club [[Gretna F.C.|Gretna]] as well as being a philanthropist to 70 [[Non-League football|non-League]] clubs.
==Early life== The eldest son of parents who were both members of [[the Salvation Army]], Mileson and his four siblings were born in [[Pennywell]], an estate in [[Sunderland, Tyne and Wear|Sunderland]], England. All the children were committed [[Christian]]s who were given a good education, brought up in a poor household. Told he would never make the sports team after breaking his back in a [[quarry]] aged 11, Mileson took up [[running]]. He won the bronze medal in the 1967 English [[Cross country running|cross country]] junior championships – then immediately stopped: "It was the happiest day of my life. I hated every minute of running, but I had something to prove."<ref name="Scotsman1">{{cite web|url=http://news.scotsman.com/opinion/A-dream-gone-up-in.3882969.jp|title=A dream gone up in smoke — Profile: Brooks Mileson|publisher=The Scotsman|date=2008-03-16|accessdate=2008-11-03}}</ref>
==Business== Starting out from school and working in the construction industry, after the then [[Durham, England|Durham]]-based Mileson was made redundant in 1982, he set up his first construction firm, before branching out into [[insurance]]. Although estimates of his wealth varied, he was said to have sold two companies for £17m and £48.6m,<ref name="Scotsman1"/> with the highest tabloid estimates at over £75 million, according to a profile in ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]''.''
Towards the end of his tenure at [[Gretna F.C.|Gretna]], Mileson was reported to be heavily in debt, with his personal bank account reported to be overdrawn by almost half a million pounds. Mileson was posthumously declared bankrupt in February 2010, after a businessman who was owed £1.85 million by Mileson made an application to Carlisle County Court.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.scotsman.com/gretnafc/Sad-decline-of-Brooks-Mileson39s.6250967.jp|title=Sad decline of Brooks Mileson's mansion as judge approves repossession|first=Patrick|last=Hill|work=[[The Scotsman]]|date=24 April 2010|accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref>
==Sport== Mileson was a devotee of grass-roots football,<ref>{{cite news|title=Mileson to help fans buy Dundee|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2006-05-20|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/d/dundee/5001272.stm|accessdate=2008-03-21}}</ref> and made donations to several football trusts, including [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle]]'s United Trust, [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]]'s Arab Trust, [[Ayr United F.C.|Ayr United]]'s Honest Men Trust, [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]]'s Dee4life Trust and [[Berwick Rangers F.C.|Berwick Rangers]]'s Supporters Trust.<ref>{{cite news|first=Stephen|last=Halliday|title=Gretna bubbly as promotion looms|publisher=[[The Scotsman]] |url=http://sport.scotsman.com/topics.cfm?tid=393&id=241992005|date=2005-03-05|accessdate=2006-03-28}}</ref> Mileson was made an honorary vice president of the [[Stockport County F.C.|Stockport County]] Supporters' Trust for the support and guidance he provided during their takeover of the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brookes Mileson becomes Honorary Vice-President|publisher=Stockport County Trust|date=August 2005|url=http://www.stockportcountytrust.com/news/n0605_brookes.asp|accessdate=2008-03-21}}</ref> He was also the president of [[Whitby Town F.C.|Whitby Town]],<ref>{{cite web|title=The Club|publisher=Whitby Town|url=http://www.whitby-town.com/info.php|accessdate=2008-03-21|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130209052335/http://www.whitby-town.com/info.php|archivedate=2013-02-09|df=}}</ref> and sponsor of the [[Northern League (football)|Northern League]].<ref name="love"/>
He failed in an attempt to buy [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], a team he supported.<ref name="love">{{cite news|last=Harris|first=Nick|title=Brooks Mileson: 'This club is in my soul. I would have ended up croaking if I had not come to Gretna'|publisher=The Independent|date=2006-02-04|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/scottish/brooks-mileson-this-club-is-in-my-soul-i-would-have-ended-up-croaking-if-i-had-not-come-to-gretna-465509.html| accessdate=2008-03-21}}</ref>
[[Gretna F.C.|Gretna]] were admitted to the [[Scottish Football League]] in 2002 in place of [[Airdrieonians F.C. (1878)|Airdrie]].<ref name = "gretna"/> Mileson took control of the club and invested heavily in the team, and they were promoted from the [[Scottish Football League Third Division|Scottish Third Division]] to the [[Scottish Premier League]] in three consecutive seasons.<ref name = "gretna">{{cite news|title=Gretna fairytale continues |publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2007|first=Colin|last=Moffat|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/g/gretna/6530071.stm|accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref> Gretna also reached the [[2006 Scottish Cup Final]] as a [[Scottish Football League Second Division|Second Division]] club, only losing to [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]].<ref name = "gretna"/>
Mileson had been in poor health in recent years resulting from his many years as a chain smoker, subsequently undergoing two stomach operations. He also suffered from [[chronic fatigue syndrome]]. He was admitted to hospital once again on 12 February 2008, suffering from a brain infection.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gretna owner Mileson in hospital|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2008-02-12|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/g/gretna/7241041.stm|accessdate=2008-03-21}}</ref> After this event, his financial support for Gretna was withdrawn, bankrupting the club and leaving Gretna without a football team to play at [[Raydale Park]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gretna relinquish league status|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2008-06-03|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/g/gretna/7433470.stm|accessdate=2008-06-15}}</ref> A new club called [[Gretna F.C. 2008|Gretna 2008]] was founded in its place.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cumberland-news.co.uk/1.202623|title=GRETNA ARE SAVED — BUT THEY WILL BE PLAYING IN ANNAN|publisher=The Cumberland News|date=2008-07-12|accessdate=2008-10-19|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090314001623/http://www.cumberland-news.co.uk/1.202623|archivedate=2009-03-14|df=}}</ref>
Mileson was not universally popular with [[football in Scotland|Scottish football]].<ref name = "gretna"/> [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]] chairman [[Geoff Brown (businessman)|Geoff Brown]] described Mileson's ownership of Gretna as an "ego trip", which had experienced a "day of reckoning" when the club went out of business.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.scotsman.com/gretnafc/Mileson-39ego39--to-blame.4147964.jp|title=Mileson 'ego' to blame, says Saints chief Brown|first=Angus|last=Wright|work=[[The Scotsman]]|date=4 June 2008|accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref>
==Death== Mileson was found unconscious on his land at his home in the village of [[Blackford, Cumbria|Blackford]], close to Gretna, on the morning of 3 November 2008. He was taken to the [[Cumberland Infirmary]] in [[Carlisle, Cumbria|Carlisle]], where he died a few hours after arrival.<ref>{{cite news|title=Football world in shock at ex-Gretna chief Brooks Mileson's death|url=http://www.newsandstar.co.uk/news/1.264484|publisher=News & Star|date=2008-11-04|accessdate=2008-11-10|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081107094159/http://www.newsandstar.co.uk/news/1.264484|archivedate=2008-11-07|df=}}</ref> A coroner ruled that the death was an accident, caused by Mileson suffering a [[Myocardial infarction|heart attack]] and then falling into a garden pond.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/football/sfl/2011/04/22/mileson-s-death-an-accident-as-gardener-recounts-how-he-found-gretna-legend-afloat-in-pond-86908-23078724/|title=Brook Mileson's death an accident as gardener recounts how he found Gretna legend afloat in pond |first=Patrick|last=Hill|work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]|date=22 April 2011|accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref>
